instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message: no liquid damage, board is clean and no signs of corrosion, display comes on external monitor but its no image or backlight on lcd, checked l8300 and <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLIT_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 12.40volts, so no voltage is passing it, <RESISTOR>R7742</RESISTOR> is 0 volts, so i removed it and hooked that line to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and then backlight started working, but there is no image..can it be <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, i have already replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7750</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message:
PRAM reset done?
Post voltage at J8300, pins 9 and 28/30.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message:
Pram reset done,
pin 9: 0v
pin 28,29,30:5v(even without lcd connected) i have seen in other board that pin 28 goes high for few seconds then it goes low, but this one stays at 5v all the times

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message:
Pin 9 should go high.
If not, 28-30 should also drop...
HPD signal comes from LCD, so check another known good assembly from same year.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message: Yeah, tried with 3 good lcds from same, but same result, removed <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and its pin 1 is corroded on chip itself, i have a board with same number, can i replace it from there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message: Yes, it has firmware, so needs donor board same model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No backlight or image
threads.message: Hi, it was l8300, that fucker had 5 volts on one side and 2 volts on other. Replaced and machine is working fine now
